translations: n．僵硬的人或物（复数形式）：指僵硬、不灵活的人或物。
· The stiffs were difficult to move.
这些僵硬的东西很难移动。
v．使僵硬（第三人称单数形式）：使某物变得僵硬、不灵活。
· The cold weather stiffs the joints.
寒冷的天气使关节变得僵硬。

phrs.translation: 脖子发僵，斜颈；顽固之人

sentences.sentence: Most of the politicians are sensibly out of town, but the poor working stiffs hardly get away at all.
sentences.translation: 绝大多数政客都明智地去了城郊，而可怜的小职员们几乎连出去的机会都没有。

sentences.sentence: They lose the ability to think clearly. Their muscles become stiffs.
sentences.translation: 他们丧失了清晰思考的能力，肌肉开始僵硬。

sentences.sentence: If you're like the rest of us working stiffs, you don't want to waste money on extras you don't need.
sentences.translation: 如果你像我们这些工薪族的话，你是不愿意把钱浪费到你不需要的功能上的。
